How can I use the `keypoolrefill` command to fill the keypool with a custom size?
You can use the `keypoolrefill` command with an optional argument `newsize` to specify the new keypool size. For example, `verus keypoolrefill 200` would fill the keypool with a size of 200.

keypoolrefill ( newsize )

Fills the keypool.

Arguments
1. newsize   (numeric, optional, default=100) The new keypool size

Examples:
> verus keypoolrefill 
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "keypoolrefill", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
